channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 5.4 million, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Trump defends decision to play golf as toll rises; WHO pauses drug trial amid safety concerns

item.description: Facing anger from healthcare workers, President Emmanuel Macron promised a "massive" investment plan for France's public health sector.
item.title: French nursing homes employees take to streets in protest

item.description: The German government takes a 20 per cent stake in the struggling airline that has been battered by the pandemic.
item.title: Germany takes Lufthansa stake in landmark $15b bailout

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Police have issued an arrest warrant for Irish national Patrick Michael O'Brien over alleged large-scale fraud.
item.title: Police issue arrest warrant over alleged roofing scammer

item.description: If you started 2020 with a plan to conceive, you may be feeling nervous due to COVID-19. Here's five things to consider if you're looking to grow your family.
item.title: So, you're planning on getting pregnant this year

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Some front line healthcare workers have been supplied with sub-standard face masks as companies exploit a Therapeutic Goods Administration rule change designed to ease a shortage of protective equipment, experts warn.
item.title: Counterfeit face masks sold to Australian hospitals

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Boris Johnson's chief adviser slapped down demands for his resignation, and revealed damaging new details of his trip to regional England at the peak of Britain's coronavirus lockdown.
item.title: Dominic Cummings refuses to apologise for 400km lockdown trip

item.description: Queen guitarist Brian May says he recently had three stents put in after experiencing "a small heart attack".
item.title: Queen guitarist Brian May reveals recent heart attack

item.description: The World Health OrganisationÂ has suspended testing the malaria drug hydroxychloroquine in COVID-19 patients due to safety concerns.
item.title: WHO pauses trial of hydroxychloroquine in COVID-19 patients due to safety concerns

item.description: Former vice president Joe Biden has made his first campaign trip outside his Delaware home since quarantining himself due to the coronavirus pandemic 10 weeks ago.
item.title: Joe Biden, wearing a mask, makes first campaign stop in months

item.description: "The Fake & Totally Corrupt News makes it sound like a mortal sin - I knew this would happen!," Trump tweeted.
item.title: Trump defends decision to play golf as US virus death toll nears 100,000

item.description: It's absolutely rolling in A-list talent but Quibi looks set to be one of the most expensive flops in history.
item.title: The $2.7b gamble: Quibi could be the costliest flop in history

item.description: A man has been charged with murder over the death of a four-year-old girl in Brisbane.
item.title: Man, 43, charged with murder of four-year-old girl in Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Australian astronomers have found evidence of a colossal collision in the infancy of the universe which sheds new light on how galaxies form.
item.title: Galactic ring of fire gives scientist clues about the early universe

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Wesfarmers' decision to take an axe to discount chain Target has put Woolworths' own struggling department store, Big W, in the spotlight.
item.title: Smaller Target puts Big W in crosshairs

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: Polling from a new campaign suggests half the country would vote in favour of an Indigenous voice in Parliament at a referendum.
item.title: âUnifying momentâ: Campaign aims to amplify Indigenous voice

item.description: In part one of the new ESPN series LANCE, Terry Armstrong says he treated the disgraced cyclist 'like an animal' before his rise to fame.
item.title: 'Kind of terrible': Lance Armstrong says stepfather used to beat him in new ESPN doco

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: At first glance, the Chinese President's latest threats to Hong Kong and Taiwan don't make much sense.
item.title: Xi's bullying has backfired so far but there's a good reason why he's trying again

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The Berejiklian government will face a revolt from the Opposition, Greens and the crossbench in the upper house if it attempts to freeze public sector wages.
item.title: Public sector wage battle looms for the Berejiklian government

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Spaced seating, arriving in shifts, no food or beer? Organisers face a host of unknowns when sport begins to let fans back in to watch live games.
item.title: Challenges at every turn if NRL wants fans back in stands on July 1

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: While social distancing measures remain in place, commuters' ability to get there using the traditional means of public transport creates a dilemma and a win for toll road companies.
item.title: Forget panic buying, panic driving is next virus fad

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Women's refuges, men's behaviour change programs and a pop-up safe house will all benefit from a $21 million domestic violence funding boost.
item.title: Bid to 'save lives' with $21m boost for domestic violence services

item.dc:creator: Supratim Adhikari
item.description: Telstra is running ahead of schedule on building out its 5G network, with the telco saying it has extended its coverage to 47 cities across Australia.
item.title: Telstra powers up 5G footprint as new spectrum comes into picture

item.description: There are two big reasons to be optimistic in National Reconciliation Week.
item.title: National reconciliation is closer than we dare imagine

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, May 26

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: More than four out of 10 adult Americans who vote Republican, actually think that Bill Gates is the modern worldâs answer to Dr Evil!
item.title: Friends, bad news, moronavirus is getting worse in the US

item.description: Australia's place in the geopolitical world should not be determined by fear or fragile dependence, but that requires upsetting powerful friends.
item.title: Australia's global status held hostage by our appetite for compliance

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: A confidential report for Australia's education ministers has urged the federal government to lock in five years of funding for preschools or face a system compromised by inefficiency and high staff turnover.
item.title: COAG preschool review highlights 'adverse' effects of funding uncertainty

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: Queenâs birthday bash, immigrants for hire and dangerous bushranger captured.
item.title: In the Herald: May 26, 1849

item.description: It was "populate or perish" as acting prime minister Frank Forde announced Australia's intention of embarking on an active postwar immigration policy.
item.title: From the Archives, 1944: Government announces post-war migration plan

item.description: We will all benefit from 80,000 years of ancestral knowledge by Indigenising our future.
item.title: Take lessons from First Nations to come out of COVID crisis a better country

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: While the Greg Mortimer floundered off the coast of South America, its Australian owner â a doctor and former neighbour to Malcolm Turnbull in Point Piper â was applying pressure behind the scenes.
item.title: 'Give limited information truthfully': The extrication of a cruise ship

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: Top five films by master Australian director Peter Weir
item.title: Top five films by master Australian director Peter Weir

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, May 26

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Jayne Hrdlicka could be Virgin's next CEO or chairman if Bain is successful in its bid for the airline. Interestingly, she's still on the payroll of her former employer.
item.title: No crying over spilt milk as advisers focus on Virgin bid

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: The education union says the boom, coupled with the expected hike in practical courses after the pandemic, shows the government must fix a shortage of teachers.
item.title: Free TAFE enrolments almost double in first year, 118 per cent surge in female students

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The Victorian government's China relationship was a potent weapon against Liberals in three swing seats, says a senior Labor operative.
item.title: Andrews government used China deal to target Liberal seats

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 26, 2020

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: Joy and strong bookings have followed the state government re-opening of many tourist businesses.
item.title: 'We did a happy dance': tourism industry fired up for re-opening

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Victorian galleries aren't rushing to open their doors despite being given the official go-ahead for June 1.
item.title: Art galleries a picture of caution as lockdown restrictions ease

item.dc:creator: Amanda Vanstone
item.description: Common sense lessons have emerged out of this pain. If they stay with us, we will be doubly lucky.
item.title: Silver linings have appeared from life under coronavirus

item.description: Reforms are the best way for Australia to emerge from a once-in-a-century crisis, and energy policy should be top of the agenda.
item.title: Bold reform needed to prevent even bigger economic blow

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Former Lord Mayor Lucy Turnbull and Chief Scientist Alan Finkel debated Australia's energy future on Q+A. They agreed on the end goal but not how to achieve it.
item.title: Chief Scientist clashes with Lucy Turnbull over 'shipping sunshine'

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Sharan Burrow, head of the peak global union body, said the COVID-19 pandemic has shown the global economy was weighted against workers.
item.title: 'They are poverty wages': Top unionist calls for living wage for front-line workers

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Prime Minister wants to overhaul Australia's $7.7 billion training sector in a "JobMaker" plan to recover from the pandemic.
item.title: 'JobMaker': Scott Morrison's skills overhaul to drive coronavirus recovery

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Return to lockdown 'highly unlikely' as global COVID-19 cases surpass 5.4 million, Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: The family of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez is pleading for anyone with information to come forward as the one year anniversary of his disappearance approaches.Â
item.title: A year after Theo's disappearance, Hayez family searches for answers

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A 35-year-old from Geelong allegedly fled the scene after respected educator Deborah Locco died in Beach Road, Beaumaris.
item.title: Man charged over alleged hit-run death of former school principal
